title: American_Top_40_1976_September_25th
description:
"Hello again and welcome to American Top 40. This is Casey Kasem and we're about to count down the forty most popular songs in America this week."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Casey gives the details of the wreck of the Edmund Fitzgerald.

A listener wants to know, "Of all the solo singers who have hit the top 40, which one has the longest name?" Well, it was Arnold Dorsey before he changed it.

Another listener writes in wanting to know, "What was the first country song to hit number one on the pop chart?" It was an anti-smoking song.

There was a band that desperately needed a keyboard player just six days away from the start of their first big American tour. When the bass player suggested letting his wife have the job, she ended up singing and writing half of their first album and two of their first four top 40 hits. That band is in this countdown.

The first all-white group to hit number one on the soul chart has a hit in the top ten.

40:    Fernando - Abba
39:    Don't Stop Believin' - Olivia Newton-John
38:    The Wreck Of The Edmund Fitzgerald - Gordon Lightfoot            
37:    You Are The Woman - Firefall
36:    Sunrise - Eric Carmen
35:    Superstar - Paul Davis
34:    Get The Funk Out Ma Face - The Brothers Johnson
33:    Baby I Love Your Way - Peter Frampton
32:    It's O.K. - The Beach Boys
31:    This Masquerade - George Benson
30:    Beth - Kiss
29:    Let 'Em In - Wings
28:    Heaven Must Be Missing An Angel (Part 1) - Tavares
27:    (Don't Fear) The Reaper - Blue Oyster Cult        
26:    One Love In My Lifetime - Diana Ross
25:    Don't Go Breaking My Heart - Elton John & Kiki Dee
24:    Magic Man - Heart
23:    I Only Want To Be With You - Bay City Rollers
22:    Shower The People - James Taylor
21:    Rock'n Me - The Steve Miller Band
20:    You Should Be Dancing - The Bee Gees

18:    Who'd She Coo - The Ohio Players

16:    She's Gone - Hall & Oates
15:    Getaway - Earth, Wind & Fire

13:    Still The One - Orleans
12:    With Your Love - Jefferson Starship

10:    You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine - Lou Rawls
9:    Disco Duck (Part 1) - Rick Dees
8:    If You Leave Me Now - Chicago
